Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
@BATTLE
Un, deux, trois, quatre- blend here, and there-
Provence? Are you still working on that creepy painting?

Fields.MenuText: The crew have complained about your paintings.
Hmm, I see what you mean.
You're too cute to be this morbid.

Fields.DialogueText: If my assistants have poor taste, then we shall simply have to teach them the value of art.
I am an artist above all else, Capitaine.
Capitaine! Whatever do you mean by that?
You're painting a Morgana shipwreck again.
Oui. I was inspired by the wreckage. Look at the shape the broken prow makes against the horizon, the texture of the rotted wood...
If the muse drives me to morbidity, I will go there gladly.
I want to challenge, not simply please.
You have an artist's eye, Capitaine!
The Morganas must be destroyed, but I can't deny, their wreckage is inspiring to behold.
Time to get inspired, then!
Provence? We've got new orders.
Ah? Where are we going? The North Sea? The German coast? The Pacific?
S'il vous plait, tell me it's not the English Channel again.
Good news, then. We're going to be in the Adriatic.
Oh, Capitaine! That's excellent news!
Are we going to Venice? I adore the architecture of Venice. The statuary, the play of light off marble--
We'll be patrolling off the Croatian coast.
Zut alors. And it's another patrol?

Fields.MenuText: You don't sound excited.
Yes, as routine as you can get.

Fields.DialogueText: If I were you, I wouldn't worry about it too much.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: We go where the Fleet sends us, Provence.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course. There's nothing there worth looking at. And no interesting battles to fight.
Routine will be the death of me.
Of course. But I wish the Fleet would stop wasting my talents.
Trouble just seems to find us.
See what I mean?
Tch. Even the Morganas we've met have been routine....
Ah! Capitaine! You startled me!
Why on earth are you sitting up on the mast?
Ow! Did a pencil just fall on my head?
I was sketching the crew. Their work leads to some fascinating poses.

Fields.MenuText: Don't you think that makes people uncomfortable?
The crew don't like it when you do that.
I didn't know someone could hold a pose that long.

Fields.DialogueText: They cannot. I've practiced sketching quickly.
My assistants don't like a lot of the things I do. And I don't care.
If they are uncomfortable, they should tell me themselves, non?
I can't argue with that, but...
But what? We are all enlisted, are we not?  We can make hard choices.
If I need to, I can capture the essence of an action in the blink of an eye.
Don't you want people to like you?
I am not here to be liked, Capitaine.
I make art to understand the world. For me, it is like breathing.
And I can respect that.
*ALARM*
Hah! Do you think I can get a sketch of the Morganas as they fall?
@BATTLE
Let's find out.
Ugh, ugh, ugh, ugh, non, non, non! This will never do.
Provence? What are you doing? You've crumpled up so much paper...
These drawings are terrible!
These are the sketches of the crew you did yesterday. Weren't you proud of them then?
My style has changed since yesterday.

Fields.MenuText: How can your entire style change overnight?
They say that you're your own worst critic.
Since yesterday? You're kidding, right?

Fields.DialogueText: If you are not strict with yourself, you will never grow.
You need to be kind to yourself, too. Or you'll never finish anything.
... Ugh. I'm going to throw these sketches into the sea.
*ALARM*
Throw them at the Morganas!
You wouldn't understand, Capitaine. My style is fluid, as ever-changing as the ocean.
I assure you, Capitaine, I am DEADLY serious!
As an artist, my style changes and shifts. If it didn't, I wouldn't ever grow.
Comme vous le dites, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
Poorly proportioned, out of scale, poor linework-
You like to read while you eat, Provence? That's a lot of books.
Oui. I want to appreciate art.
"Histoire Generale de L'Art"... "Renoir: A Life In Color"... "The Life and Works of Van Gogh"?
The Impressionists are dear to my heart. Creating an image of the world from the heart and not the head?
It's what we all aspire to, isn't it?
Hmm, maybe. Oh, what's this one- "Shunga: The Beauty of Flowers"?
D-Don't touch that!
I appreciate ukiyo-e prints, but this was the only book of them I could find. It's very precious to me.
I won't touch it again. Anyway... What's this one, "Pictures on Exhibit?"
...Oh. Those... aren't flowers. Those are women with... um... open kimonos.
Oui. I'm... interested in the art style. Not the. "Flowers."
It's a magazine of art that is currently on exhibition. They take pictures, you know, show you the museums of the world.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you'll get to see them one day.
Maybe your art will be there one day.
You really like art, don't you?

Fields.DialogueText: Hah! You're very funny, Capitaine.
If my art is to mean anything, it should be too shocking for the Academie, too outre for the Louvre.
I can't leave the ship, Capitaine. Paris herself is three hundred miles inland.
And I don't mind that, the sea is my home, but... It does mean I'll never visit a museum in the flesh.
I don't regret that. I'd just like to be able to see more artwork.
With my own eyes, or through the eye of a camera, it doesn't matter to me.
Art is my passion in life, Capitaine. I'd marry it if I could.
I have given my life to art, even though I'll never be able to set foot in a museum.
Besides, I can't set foot in a museum anyway. I can't leave the ship.
Would you like it if I got you more art books?
I'd be overjoyed.
*ALARM*
Remind me AFTER the battle.
Oui, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
Hey, Provence - you like architecture, right?
What kind of architecture?
We're going to be passing some Italian ossuaries on this patrol. I thought you'd like to know.
Those big fascist graveyards? The ones designed by Venturi?

Fields.MenuText: Those are the ones.
You don't sound too happy.
Why the long face?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course I am unhappy. You promised me architecture.
Augh! I was wrong to think that anything good could come from this voyage. Much less architecture.
Because you promise me architecture, and give me a farce.
And the ossuaries aren't architecture because...?
Because they're the work of a hack!
I don't follow you; care to explain?
Fascist architects disgust me. They do not care for the landscape or the shape of their work, they only want to project strength.
Speer is a hack. And the architect who built these graveyards? He's copied Speer!
A hack copying a hack. Feugh.
You'd better not let the military censors hear you say that. They'd have kittens.
Let them come! I'll fend them off like Morganas.
*ALARM*
Agh, you jinxed us.
@BATTLE
Capitaine? What do you do when you've lost your inspiration?
Your inspiration?
For one's art.
I've been continuing the shipwreck painting. But it's lost its spark.
I see. And you think I can help?
I thought you might have some experience with this kind of thing. You inspire your crew, non?

Fields.MenuText: That's not the same thing, Provence...
Have you tried looking at nature? That inspires me.
Maybe you could look at more art?

Fields.DialogueText: Isn't it, though? You can make the crew stand and fight, even in the face of death.
Well, yes, but....
Hmmm. You may be onto something there.
I want to be original, but the best art makes one want to create, no?
Maybe. But we've been surrounded by ocean for weeks. You'd think that would help.
*ALARM*
Maybe the thrill of battle will inspire you?
Do-or-die is one thing. Making something new, that's not my speciality.
I suppose it can't hurt to try.
@BATTLE
Provence? Why have you got the deck marked off?
I thought you were working on the shipwreck painting.
I was! But I've decided to devote some time to other projects. I've wanted to paint a mural on the aft deck for a while...

Fields.MenuText: Do you think the Fleet will approve?
Are you going to lose your inspiration for this, too?
The aft deck *has* been a little plain.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm so glad you agree.
In some ways, my ship is my body. I decorate it as I please.
Au contraire, Capitaine. Doing this might inspire me to finish the shipwreck.
Well, yes, but the fleet wouldn't let you pierce your nose either.
I'd be happy to help you make a design, but...
It might, but...
Captain, what's all this? We were getting ready to run gun drills.
I.... I didn't realize anyone was using this deck today.
We have gun drills scheduled until 1500. Sorry, Mademoiselle.
Looks like you'd better clean up.
Oui, Capitaine, it'd appear so.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Why do you look so blue?
It's petty, Capitaine. Let's finish these witches off!
Piroulirouli, pirouliroula... lalalalala, lalalalala...
Whoa, Provence, that's a lot of lavender! What are you going to do with it all?
I'm restocking the ship's supply, sir.
That doesn't answer my question.
I like to use lavender and sage to fill the empty space in the hold. It gives it a wonderful smell.

Fields.MenuText: That seems like it'd take up a lot of space.
Is lavender your favourite scent, then?
That's a wonderful idea! Why don't more ships do that?

Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
You have exquisite taste, Capitaine.
Unfortunately, not all Belles are lucky enough to have a Capitaine like you.
If you are not using your senses, you might as well not have them!
Oui, Capitaine. It reminds me of the fields of my homeland.
And besides that, it's just a pleasant smell. Better than grease or salt.
Capitaine, you insult my intelligence! Were it too bulky, I wouldn't bring it aboard.
It crushes nicely and is easy enough to remove. And pleasant smells are as important to life as good food.
You truly understand, Capitaine.
Oof. That's a sensory experience I'd rather not have.
@BATTLE
Sensory experiences are the building blocks of art.
Agreed, Capitaine.
Provence, what on earth are you doing?
Isn't it obvious, Capitaine?
You're stuck to the mast sideways like a spider! Get down from there.
D'accord, d'accord.
How did you even get yourself up there?
Remember, Capitaine, I am a Belle.
This vessel is a part of me. I can go anywhere aboard it, regardless of how unreasonable it might seem.

Fields.MenuText: It's unnatural. I don't like it.
Have you always been able to do this?
It's unnatural. I love it.

Fields.DialogueText: Unnatural? Capitaine, you must remember, I am a Belle. Not a human.
Of course, Capitaine! Remember, I am a Belle. Not a human.
Capitaine! You have quite the sense of humour.
Would you look askance at a bird for flying, or a fish for swimming?
I suppose not...
I really do like it. You're a fascinating person, Provence.
How do you do that so easily, anyway?
For me, it's as easy as it is for a bird to fly or a fish to swim.
For me, it's as easy to hang from the mast as it is for a bird to fly or a fish to swim.
I am the ship, and the ship is me. That's all there is to it, Capitaine.
Why were you up there, anyway?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
I wanted to get a different view of the situation.
I thought maybe with a new perspective, I could finish my painting.
Well, look on the bright side, at least now you'll have more wreckage to paint.
Capitaine, why did you call me into your cabin? Is something wrong?
Not exactly, Provence, but I'm worried about you.
Worried? Capitaine, there's no need to worry, I'm fine!
Well, I haven't seen you making any art for a while, and that's not like you.
Capitaine! S-sometimes the fields must lay fallow, you know?
It is not the end of the world if I am not constantly in motion, or anything!
Well, you said that for you, making art is like breathing. So I thought I'd check in.
Why do you care, Capitaine?

Fields.MenuText: Because if my Belle is in poor order, so is the ship.
Because you're part of my crew.
Because you're my friend.

Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
Zut! I think we have more important things to attend to, don't you?
@BATTLE
That may be so, but I am not a child. I can look after myself.
Your concern is appreciated, but if something is wrong with the ship, I'm sure the mechanics will let you know.
Well! I'm. I'm touched, Capitaine.
It's not the mechanics I'm worried about...
I never said you were a child, but-
But I stand by what I said: I'm fine. I'll finish the piece I'm working on eventually.
Have some faith in me, Capitaine.
I do, Provence. It's just-
Captain, our Belle is swearing so much that the comms are getting jammed. Can you make her stop?
I'll see what I can do.
Zut! C'est foutu, je crois, vachement-
Provence? What's eating you?
Ah! Capitaine, you startled me.
Why do you keep fussing over me? I've told you I'm fine.

Fields.MenuText: Because you're not fine, and I'm tired of you lying.
Because I'm worried about you. You're my Belle.
Because at this rate, you're going to spring a leak.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitaine! I have been in service since 1916.
That's... I don't know what to say, Capitaine...
You're an important part of my crew. I'm not going to leave you out to hang.
Capitaine! Do NOT impugn me.
If there were something wrong with me, a mechanic would surely have caught it by now.
I am many, many things, but I am not a liar.
You don't have to fill the comms with curses, I promise. Talk to me, Provence.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Ah. Is that the problem?
I grew... heated when one of my sketches wasn't cooperating. That's all. I'll try to keep off the open channels.
'Wasn't cooperating'?
It didn't fit my current style. Realism is dead.
Let's make these Morganas realistic, then.
YAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA-
Provence! Why are you trying to destroy your shipwreck painting?
Take that! And this! Goddamned vlakas putain-
You've thrown paint all over it and - oh. Thaaaaaat's a knife.
A palette knife, Capitaine.
YAH!
You've slashed your painting to ribbons!
Oui, Capitaine. Is it any of your business?
You're going back and forth so fast- you're acting so angry, but you're talking so calmly-
I fail to see how that is your problem, Capitaine.
RRR-RRRIP!
You've sliced it in half!
Oui.

Fields.MenuText: This is unbecoming of you.
How could you? It was beautiful!
Why are you doing this? I thought you needed art.

Fields.DialogueText: Merde, Capitaine, I thought you had *taste.*
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
And I'm too old to care about propriety, Capitaine. This abominable painting deserves whatever I can throw at it.
I need it to understand. But I don't need to keep every godforsaken piece of - trash - that I've ever spat out.
Put your anger to work somewhere useful.
Oui, Capitaine.
Provence? Where are you?
Provence?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
I'm here. To arms?
If we're done here-
Wait.
... I'm listening.
You've practically gone AWOL.
I have been right here this entire time!

Fields.MenuText: Your only sign of life has been cursing over the radio.
I haven't seen hide or hair of you for days.
I've missed talking to you, Pro'. Please...

Fields.DialogueText: I've missed you too, but I'm terrible company right now.
I've been around. Please, Capitaine, trust me- I need to be alone.
I have tried to keep that to a minimum!
It feels like this ship doesn't even have a Belle.
Capitaine! How could you-
- And I want Provence's soul back. Tell me what I need to do.
...I need to be alone. But if you could... check up on me, from time to time.
Make sure that I'm not too lost in my own head and my own problems.
That, I can do.
...Aaaand she's gone...
Provence? Status report.
Ughhhhh...
Provence? I'm coming in.
That won't be necessary, Capitaine...
*Creeeeeak...*
Provence! Your cabin's a sty, and you're draped over your bed like it's a fainting couch!
... Haven't felt like cleaning. No inspiration.
Surely *cleaning* doesn't take *inspiration*, does it?
I cannot do anything if I am not inspired to do it. It is like walking uphill through tar.
With no shoes on?
You know I hate shoes! They keep you from experiencing the world!
Of course, of course.
Anyway. I'm checking in on you, like you asked me to do. What do you need?
Give me some direction, Capitaine. I need to unstick myself.
All right, then. I need you...

Fields.MenuText: To clean your cabin.
To draw something for me.
To get some rest.

Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
@BATTLE
... Of course, Morganas take priority over any of that.
Of course, sir.
Capitaine! I have done nothing but rest today!
Well, if you're too exhausted to do anything, you need your rest.
Would that I could, Capitaine. My inspiration is at low tide.
Urgh... I've been avoiding that...
Which is exactly why you need to do it *now*.
Capitaine? That's a big box.
It's for you. Here- oof!
Are these books?
Mmhm. When we stopped to refuel, I sent some sailors out to find every book about art they could.
Most of them are in Italian or Greek, but...
That won't be a problem, Capitaine. I speak both fluently.
Well, there you go.
There's a book about Van Gogh, a book of Matisse, a few books about the Impressionists, and- oh...
Did you find it?
... Is this a book of Japanese art?
Yes. And it's not even a book of ... *ahem*... flowers.
Would you have brought me flowers if I asked?

Fields.MenuText: Er. What?
Depends. What kind of 'flowers'?
Of course. Anything for my Belle.

Fields.DialogueText: I like pressed flowers. Preserved forever between the pages of a book, in all their beauty, forever beloved...
How can you look so demure while saying things like that?
You're too sweet, Capitaine.
It's a simple question, isn't it?
Why, Capitaine! I thought we were talking about flowers!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
I want you to be happy, even if it isn't with me.
*Ahem.* ...Does this mean you have your inspiration back?
It's a little embarrassing...
We'll have to see. For now- let's deal with these godforsaken witches!
Provence! You’ve been reading the Matisse book, I see?
Non. This is more recent- it’s the Surrealists.

Fields.MenuText: Those nutters?
You have an interesting taste in art.
It seems like you have a lot of things in common with them.

Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
@BATTLE
Capitaine, please! They’re pushing the limits of what art can be!
Thank you! I wish I had half their talent.
I’m choosing to take that as a compliment.
So, does this mean you’ve got your inspiration back?
Hah! I wish.
I have some ideas, but… all I’ve wanted to paint lately is scenes of shipwrecks.
After a while, they all start to look the same.
Should I be worried?
Non, it’s not about my own mortality. Broken ships make fascinating shapes.
Broken masts, exposed engines, open holds….
I guess that makes sense. Like how human artists are about skeletons.
Exactement! It’s things broken down to their most base elements.
Maybe you could try painting something else broken down?
Maybe. The Surrealists, they’ve been breaking down art itself.
Collage, assemblage, frottage… It’s inspiring, in its way, but…
I don’t think I could do anything that interesting.
I believe in you. You’ll figure it out eventually.
For now, let’s take apart these Morganas!
Thank you for inviting me to your cabin!
It’s no problem. We got some lavender tea while we were in port, and I know it’s your favourite….
It is. And this is the good stuff.
Glad you approve.
Capitaine? I wanted to say… Thank you.
For what?
... I haven’t been doing well lately, and you’ve been very kind.

Fields.MenuText: I thought you were 'fine'.
It’s the least I could do.
We need you in good condition. Mental and physical.

Fields.DialogueText: ... I didn’t want to worry you. But...
Still. I can’t imagine every Capitaine would hunt down those books for me.
Of course, Capitaine.
I think I’ve been having a hard time for much longer than I realized.
I’m one of the oldest Belles in the fleet, you know? I’ve been in service since 1916.
And the entire time, I’ve been doing routine patrols, routine training exercises, routine routine routine.
During my Black Period... I spent an entire year in dry dock, doing nothing.
Maybe your ‘routine’ has kept you alive.
You know me, Capitaine. I need to live fully. To move forward, to do, to create.
And as a warship… what I create is destruction. If I can’t fight, and I can’t make art… If I can’t distinguish myself...
I don't care! It’s not dying that frightens me, Capitaine, it’s dying without having lived.
*ALARM*
Well, here's a chance for you to live.
Très drôle, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
What’re you looking at, Provence?
We reached the ossuary, Capitaine. The fascist graveyard you told me about.
Hm? And what do you think of it?
I think…
It’s a disgrace to architecture!
That's what I thought you'd say.
Look at it! It’s like a giant welt on the landscape. And that monument in the middle- ugh!
This architect has not read his Freud.
Zut alors. I could do better than this!

Fields.MenuText: You sound very sure of yourself.
Have you no respect for the dead?
If you could do better, why haven't you?

Fields.DialogueText: Because it’s the simple truth, Capitaine! This is an eyesore.
It would respect the dead to have a monument that isn’t hideous.
I haven’t had the chance. Give me a year and a drafting table…
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
If it makes you so angry, then why don’t you stop looking at it?
Because it’s giving me ideas.
Oh? Are they inspiration?
Perhaps. We’ll have to see.
Why don't we make you some more shipwrecks?
Excellent idea, Capitaine.
Capitaine?  I need your advice.
Hmm? What is it?
See this?
That's that painting you tore up, isn't it?
"Morganas in Red," yes.
I wanted your help figuring out what to do with it.
It feels unfair to the work not to finish it. But the canvas is so torn up...

Fields.MenuText: Can you mend the canvas?
Maybe you need to start fresh.
Can you use the canvas pieces for another painting?

Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
@BATTLE
No, I think it's beyond saving. I cut it right down the middle...
I thought about that, but... well, I want to finish something for once, and not hate it.
Hm. You might be onto something there...
Wait. That book you gave me.  The one about the Surrealists...
What about it?
The collages Ernst made are so stunning. And between the books you found and the torn painting, I've got so much material...
Mon dieu, I think I can make this work!
Argh! Why must they appear at the EXACT most inconvenient moment?
They have a gift for that...
*RIP!*
Provence? What are you up to?
I'm tearing more pieces out of my shipwreck painting. Need to get them straight and square.
What are you planning to do with them?
I'm going to turn them into parts of an assemblage. It recontextualizes them.
They're no longer a failed painting, they're a statement on the ephemerality of art.

Fields.MenuText: I ... see.
Do you want some help?
Isn't that what art is about? Making a statement?

Fields.DialogueText: You don't have to understand it, Capitaine! I just hope it moves you.
Ah! I appreciate the sentiment, Capitaine, but I doubt you could tear this like a Belle could.
I'm so glad you understand, Capitaine.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
One way or another, it probably will.
You are stronger than you look...
I try to keep up with your interests. You never know when it'll come in handy.
Of course I am!
Argh! As inconvenient as ever...
I make my art for myself, but... it's nice to be appreciated.
Leave the canvas! You can finish it later.
(singing) C'est ansi que cœur à cœur, on cueille, comme une fleur...
Hey, Provence! How's the collage coming?
Aaaah! Don't come in!
Ah, I won't! But why not?

Fields.MenuText: Is this because your room's still a mess?
Are you hiding the painting?
Did I intrude on something?

Fields.DialogueText: Not exactly, Capitaine. But I don't want you to come in just yet.
In a way, sir. --And it's an assemblage now.
Hey! I swabbed it out last night!
Sure you did.
I don't want anyone to see the assemblage before it's done. That's all.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
You think it's bad luck?
It might be. But I'm more worried about undue influence.
I don't want anyone telling me how to put it together or what to use. No suggestions until it's done.
Why?
Because I don't want any reason to doubt myself.
If I begin to doubt myself, I lose my inspiration. And then... well, you've seen what becomes of me.
Fair enough. I won't trouble you til it's done.
Zut. You may not bother me, but they certainly will!
Let's shoo them off.
Oui. Then I can get back to work.
It will be ready when it is ready, and not a moment before.
Provence? What're you sketching?
Sainte Mère de Dieu! You scared me, Capitaine.
Didn't mean to startle you!  I was just surprised.
Surprised? Surely-surely nothing I'm doing is that out of the ordinary, Capitaine!

Fields.MenuText: I thought you were working on the assemblage.
True, you're always drawing...
It's the way you're reacting that's suspicious.

Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
@BATTLE
I am! But I don't want to cut apart every book on the ship for spare parts.
If I can draw some parts of the assemblage, that makes it easier.
Of course I am. And I cannot only work on one thing at a time!
I assure you, nothing nefarious can happen here.
I don't think it's nefarious, exactly, but...
Why do I get the feeling you aren't telling me the whole truth?
I would never lie to you!
I don't think you're lying, exactly, just... talking around something.
If I told you it was a surprise for you, would that give you peace of mind?
Yes, actually.
Then it's a surprise for you. Please don't worry about it.
You could have just said that-
Worry about the Morganas!
You are something else...
Are you ready to see my masterpiece, Capitaine?
Of course!
*ALARM*
I can't believe the assemblage is finally finished!
Neither can I! It feels like I've been working on it forever.
Once you had it figured out, you finished it nearly overnight...
Details!
Sir, Morganas coming in from starboard!
Of course they'd show up now.
Sir! Morganas approaching from port!
All right. Prepare to retreat. We can't take two full fleets.
Are you sure that's necessary, Capitaine?

Fields.MenuText: Are you questioning my authority?
Have you got a better idea?
I can't put my crew at risk...

Fields.DialogueText: Oui, Capitaine.
Pas de tout! But if you'll listen for a second-
You don't have to, sir!
@BATTLE
Both fleets have seen us. If we gun it through the middle, there's a good chance they'll open fire on each other.
... And then we clean up the stragglers.
Precisely. I know it's risky, but it's  less risky than a full retreat.
Hm. Are you suggesting this plan because you think it'll let you unveil your assemblage sooner?
Only partly.
... All right. It's risky, but I think we can pull it off.
Maintain our current course- and full steam ahead.
We did it! The fleets fired on each other, and we fought them off!
Let's not get cocky. We've still got to clean up the stragglers.
@BATTLE
Well, we didn't get cocky, did we?

Fields.MenuText: ... I want to inspire you.
... I want to be your muse.

Fields.DialogueText: No. That went much better than it could have.
Now, weren't you going to show me something?
Of course. Come back this way, and- voila!
Oh! Is that the assemblage?
Yes, Capitaine. I used elements from my old art books, from a few of the books you gave me, and of course, from the old painting.
It's not perfect. I can see so many mistakes...
I can't. And even if I could... remember what you said about self-doubt?
... Ugh. Yes, Capitaine, I do.
It'll get you every time.
That it will. Capitaine...
I don't think I could have done this without you. Any of this. I would have abandoned the assemblage as I have abandoned so many other paintings.
You had it in you all along.
Maybe so. But it feels like I was a pile of kindling, and then you came along with a matchbox.
You've lit up my life in so many ways. I'm honoured to have you as my Capitaine.
And I'm honoured to have *you* by my side. As long as we're together...
